sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It's Monday, the 30th of May. Good morning, Europe. A very warm welcome to the program.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Let's begin by looking at our top stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: President Zelensky vows to rebuild and restore as he visits the devastated city of Kharkiv.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Russia continues to gain ground in the eastern Donbass region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Germany's economy minister warns that EU unity on a Russian oil embargo is starting to crumble as leaders meet to discuss a sixth round of sanctions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And US President Joe Biden visits Uvalde, Texas, the site of last week's deadly school shooting.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The Department of Justice says it will investigate the police response.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Russia says what it calls the liberation of the Donbas region of eastern Ukraine

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: is an unconditional priority.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Defending the invasion that it maintains is about demilitarizing its neighbor.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Its forces continue to gain ground, albeit slowly, pounding cities, causing casualties and widespread damage to housing, despite its claim that it doesn't target civilians.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Over the weekend, President Zelensky visited the front line in the city of Kharkiv and announced that he'd fired the regional head of security.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: I came to see the situation for myself and fired the head of security service in the region for not working on the defense of the city from the beginning of the invasion, thinking only about himself instead.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Why did he do that? What were his motives?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Our legal authorities will figure it out.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In the capital Kiev, the priority now is reconstruction.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It's believed around half the city's 2 million people have been forced or chose to flee their homes amidst the bombardment.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Authorities say around 32 million euros, a third of its present reconstruction funds, will go to the region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: People fleeing from the east continue to arrive in regions regarded, at least for now, as secure. This train was chartered by Doctors Without Borders. Since March, the organisation has helped to move at least 600 people away from the fighting.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: European unity on a Russian oil embargo is starting to crumble.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: German Economy Minister Robert Habeck has warned ahead of a two-day EU summit to discuss a new package of sanctions against Moscow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Currently, the bloc member states still haven't agreed on a Russian oil embargo.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The proposal to face out imports of crude over the next six months and refined oil by the end of the year was put forward by the Commission President Ursula von der Leyen weeks ago.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Its fate remains uncertain.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The main obstacle comes from Hungary's President Viktor Orban, whose country strongly depends on Russian oil.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: On Friday, European countries tried to compromise in order to win over Hungary and unblock the sanctions by proposing a deal to embargo seaborne deliveries of Russian oil, but allow deliveries by pipeline. As Western allies try to move away from Russian

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: energy, Serbia is taking a step towards it. On Sunday, Serbia's president, Aleksandar Vucic, said he signed what he called an extremely favorable new three-year gas supply contract after a phone call with Russian President Vladimir Putin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: In a statement about the call, the Kremlin's press service said issues of bilateral relations, including steps to expand mutually beneficial trade and economic cooperation, were discussed in detail.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It was agreed in particular that Russia would continue to supply natural gas to Serbia without interruption.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Vucic has refused to explicitly condemn Russia's invasion of Ukraine, and Serbia has not joined Western sanctions against Moscow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: His country is almost entirely dependent on Russian gas, and its major energy companies are under Russian-majority ownership.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: But getting Russian gas into Serbia could be difficult if the EU shuts off supply through its member states.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: U.S. President Joe Biden visited the memorial of last week's school shooting in Uvalde, Texas,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: where 21 people were killed, most of them children.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Spurred on by the massacre, the president is trying to pass what he calls common-sense gun control laws and toughen firearm regulations, especially on assault weapons.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Dozens of people paid tribute to the victims on Sunday and made desperate pleas to politicians to act against the gun violence plaguing the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: I'm happy he's here. It's honored. We're honored that he's here. And I guess just stop selling guns period. That's my opinion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Yeah, I think you should just get stricter and let go.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: No more guns. I mean, tobacco you can get at at 18 at 21 now, and now guns you can get at 18. There's something wrong right there.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Yes. I think 18-year-olds shouldn't be able to buy any weapons. I think the weapons, the assault weapons, I'm retired military, assault weapons are not for the public.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: weapons are not for the public. So far, Biden and the Democrats' efforts to enact stricter rules regarding guns have been stonewalled by the Republican blockade on the Congress floor.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The political deadlock over power sharing in Northern Ireland continues as the DUP refuses to form a new administration until action is taken regarding the Northern Irish Protocol.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Euronews reporter Ken Murray has more.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The Northern Ireland Parliament at Stormont outside Belfast meets for the second time in four weeks today in the hope and expectation of electing a speaker, a First Minister and Deputy First Minister. However the leader of the pro-British Democratic Unionist Party Sir Geoffrey Donaldson has said that this is nothing more than a stunt.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: He has said repeatedly since February that he will not sit in any executive unless outstanding matters on the Northern Ireland Protocol are satisfactorily addressed by London and Brussels. The Northern Ireland Protocol is an imaginary border in the Irish Sea and what it does it effectively means that goods entering Northern Ireland which is in the United Kingdom, from England, Scotland and Wales, have to go through customs checks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Now, the DUP make the point that this is unacceptable as it isolates Northern Ireland from the rest of the United Kingdom and they see it as being nothing more than another incremental step towards a united Ireland, which is something they oppose.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: So the difficulty for London and Brussels is that, as far as they are concerned, the protocol has been addressed, albeit that it requires some tweaking.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: London has problems at present. Boris Johnson's leadership is under threat.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: There is a growing number of MPs in his party calling for his resignation, while Brussels has taken the view that the protocol matters have been put to bed since December in 2020, its main focus now is the crisis in Ukraine. Matters are not helped for the politicians in Northern Ireland by the fact that there is already a cost of living crisis. And what irritates the electorate more than anything else is the fact that since the 90 mlas members of the legislative assembly in northern ireland were elected on may 5th they are getting paid for doing no work so it looks as if this log jam is going to continue for the foreseeable future this is ken marie for euronews in dublin This is Ken Murray for Euronews in Dublin. having become very weak due to being in fresh water and being infected with a black fungus which is impacting its organs, skin and brain functions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The orca has been spotted multiple times in the iconic French River since April 5th.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The authorities did not specify how or where it will be euthanized.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The UK government is calling on UEFA to investigate scenes at the Champions League final in Paris on Saturday after police used tear gas and pepper spray on Liverpool fans trying to get in.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Although many turned up without tickets, those who did still found it difficult to get into the stadium.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Absolutely shambolic. The French, their organisation and UEFA is just horrendous.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The chaos led to the kick-off being delayed for around an hour.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The British government called the treatment of the fans deeply concerning.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Liverpool eventually lost 1-0 to Real Madrid, but travelling back to the UK, fans were more concerned about the way it had all been handled.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Losing the game doesn't matter.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: People could have been killed last night because of the organisation. Yes, we lost the game, it was really disappointing. When you've been caught in a crush outside a football ground, when you see little children crying because they have tear gas and pepper spray in their eyes, children being lifted out of crowds onto fences to get them out. You can't go in and enjoy a game, the result doesn't matter.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It was a sad end to a great season for Liverpool.
